data.text: How Do You Secure Your Bike While Bikepacking?

How does everyone secure their bike while bike packing? What if you have an expensive ride? Do you just take your budget bike in case? Do you lock it to your tent, etc? Do you tend to stay away from blogging, posting about your activity until the next day?

data.text: Keep in mind that while bikepacking you're near your bike almost constantly. Heavy duty bike locks aren't necessary. Minor ones that act as a deterrent are all you need. I use a short cable and a tiny master lock with a key. I think the combo weighs an ounce.

data.text: Pulling a cargo trailer. Ride up to the stack of campfire logs, or the newspaper dispenser, or the garbage can next to the entrance of the gas station, wedging the front wheel. It takes practice to ride forward with a trailer attached; going in reverse, even just a few yards, is a challenge which has deterred the bike thieves who have crossed my path (so far).

data.text: I have never had a concern about my bike being stolen while camping. It is always so close to me that it could not be taken without my knowledge. When it comes to hitting a town for resupply, I typically ride with a lightweight folding lock from Abus. This summer I will be in NYC for a week and would not think about using anything other than the most industrial kryptonite U-lock I can find.

data.text: Depends on the area, out in the middle of nowhere I'll attach my bike to my tent or put it between my tent and a tree or something. Definitely lock it up at most public campgrounds. A light cable lock and something to wake you up if it moves is adequate.
